content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `ispersonal` that returns a trait if the provided Vehicle type is a personal vehicle for everyday driving. All vehicles are subtypes of AbstractVehicle. Function must work for types: Car, Motorcycle, Bus, Truck. The first two should return true, the latter two should return false . The function should default to false for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle. Provide an example.

Here is a possible implementation in Julia:

```julia
abstract type AbstractVehicle end

struct Car <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Motorcycle <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Bus <: AbstractVehicle end
struct Truck <: AbstractVehicle end

function ispersonal(::Car)::Bool
    return true
end

function ispersonal(::Motorcycle)::Bool
    return true
end

function ispersonal(::Bus)::Bool
    return false
end

function ispersonal(::Truck)::Bool
    return false
end

function ispersonal(vehicle::AbstractVehicle)::Bool
    return false  # Default case for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle
end
```

The function `ispersonal` takes an instance of a vehicle as argument and returns whether it's a personal vehicle or not. For the types Car and Motorcycle, it returns true indicating they are suitable for everyday driving. On the contrary, the Bus and Truck types return false indicating that they aren't suitable for daily commuting. The default case for any other subtype of AbstractVehicle is also defined to return false.

You can test this function with an example:
```julia
julia> vehicle = Car()
Car

julia> ispersonal(vehicle)
true

julia> vehicle = Motorcycle()
Motorcycle

julia> ispersonal(vehicle)
true

julia> vehicle = Bus()
Bus

julia> ispersonal(vehicle)
false

julia> vehicle = Truck()
Truck

julia> ispersonal(vehicle)
false

julia> vehicle = Vehicle()  # Assuming Vehicle to be a subtype of AbstractVehicle not defined in the code above
Vehicle

julia> ispersonal(vehicle)
false
```
